doc.title: TeXML: an XML vocabulary for TeX
doc.p: TeXML is an XML vocabulary for TeX. A processor translates TeXML source into TeX.

table.caption: Example of TeXML to TeX translation

doc.p: One of the main benefits of TeXML usage is an automatical translation of the TeX special symbols.

table.caption: Example of translation of special TeX symbols

doc.p: Default output encoding is utf8. TeXML processor escapes out-of-encoding chars automatically.

table.caption: Example of translation of non-ASCII characters

doc.p: Rationalities and objectives of TeXML were presented by Douglas Lovell at the Tex Users Group meeting in 1999. His paper is available online on TUG site: “TeXML: Typesetting XML with TeX” (PDF, 180 Kb). There was a Java implementation of TeXML by IBM alphaWorks, but now this realization “has been retired”.
